titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Virginia History Federation Records, 1966-1977
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 42919
titlepage.author: Trenton Hizer

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia History Federation records, 1966-1977. Accession 42919. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia History Federation was formed in 1968 by various historical societies in Virginia in an effort to coordinate and strengthen the efforts of these organizations in their presentation of Virginia history. The organization changed its name to Virginia History and Museums Federation in 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1966-1977, of the Virginia History Federation consisting of correspondence, meeting and seminar papers, organization papers, financial papers, publications, articles, lists, and miscellaneous papers. Records detail the creation and operation of the Virginia History Federation, its structure, and its finances.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, 1966-1977, concerns the creation and operation of the Virginia History Federation and consists mainly of letters to and from the organization's president, secretary, and treasurer. Correspondence also concerns membership within the organization, its meetings, and its seminars. It also contains correspondence of its transition into the Virginia History and Museum Federation. Also concerns historic sites, museums, and legislation concerning history and its presentation to the public. Also includes photocopy of an 1895 letter regarding railroad mileage for Norfolk and Western Railroad in Pocahontas, Virginia; and a 1903 letter from William E. Dodd regarding access to documents in the Virginia State Library.

Meetings, Seminars contains minutes and agendas for the Virginia History Federation's annual Spring and Fall meetings and its board meetings. Also contains agendas, flyers, brochures, and registration forms concerning its seminars on aspects of presenting history to the public.

did.unittitle: Spring Conference, 1-3 May 1969 (Natural Bridge) See also American Association of State and Local History Conference of Southern Historical Societies (box 13, folder 2).
Small Museum Exhibits Techniques Seminar, 14-16 February 1969 (Richmond--Valentine Museum).

scopecontent.p: Organization Papers contains various drafts and final copies of the Virginia History Federation's constitutions, including votes on the reworking of the organization's constitution in 1975. Also includes reports, speeches, talks, articles and other papers concerning the purpose and programs of the Virginia History Federation.

did.unittitle: Virginia Museum of Science and History, March-October 1967.
Draft constitutions for Virginia History Federation and constitutions for the Virginia History Federation, September-October 1967.

scopecontent.p: Financial Papers includes financial accounts of the Virginia History Federation, dues paid to the Federation, receipts and paid bills, as well as other financial records.

did.unittitle: Tax records and papers, 1967-1971, 1975-1976, no date.

scopecontent.p: Publications contains copies of the Federation's journal, The Virginia Phoenix, 1968-1974, including drafts; and issues of its newsletters published under various titles, including Newsletter,Virginia Phoenix Gazette, and VHMF Newsletter.

did.unittitle: Newsletter of the Virginia History Federation and Virginia Phoenix, 1968.
Virginia Phoenix, including drafts of articles 1973.
Virginia Phoenix advertisement sheets, no date.

scopecontent.p: Articles contains press releases and clippings concerning the Virginia History Federation and its members. Series also contains press releases and clippings concerning other historical topics.
Lists contains membership lists and dues paid lists for the Virginia History Federation and its journal.

did.unittitle: Virginia History Federation Directory of Historical Societies and History-oriented Organizations in Virginia.

scopecontent.p: Miscellany contains correspondence, journals and newsletters, forms and applications, minutes, brochures, reports, and ads from various historical societies, historic sites, and professional organizations in Virginia and the United States. Miscellany also includes legislation and resolutions passed by the United States House of Representatives and the Virginia House of Delegates. Also includes a research paper by Guy V. Cavallo on Arlington, Virginia, voting trends.

did.unittitle: American Association for State and Local History.
American Association for State and Local History Conference of Southern Historical Societies, 1-4 May 1969(Natural Bridge). See also Spring Conference, 1-3 May 1969 (box 6, folder 1).
American Bicentennial Commission newsletter and fact sheet, February 1971.
Federated Arts Council of Richmond, Inc., meeting, 29 May 1974.
Historical Society of Washington County, Virginia, Inc., newsletters, 1973-1974.
10th International Congress of Genealogical and Heraldic Sciences, 1970.
National American Studies Faculty Community Museums Programs.
National Historical Publications and Records Commission.
New York Bicentennial Commission newsletter The Correspondent, 1970-1971.
Norfolk Historical Society newsletters and bulletins, 1967-1968.
Guy V. Cavallo research paper--Arlington Voting Trends, 1960-1972.
United States House of Representatives legislation and resolutions, 1969, 1974.
Societies--Smyth County Historical and Museum Society Inc., Tennessee Association of Museums, and League of Historical Societies of New Jersey.
Museum and historic sites brochures--Lynchburg Historical Museum and Red Hill Shrine.

Newsletters--Notes on Virginia (Virginia Historic Landmarks Commission), Cultural Cross-Currents (Virginia Commission of the Arts and Humanities), Microforum (Microfilming Corporation of America), Prison Civil War Round Table Newsletter, and RCHA News (Regional Conference of Historical Agencies--New York).

24th Annual Seminars on American Culture at Cooperstown (New York State Historical Association), Twenty-Ninth Conference in Early American History (Sleepy Hollow Restorations, Inc., and Institute of Early American History and Culture), Historical Resources: Finding, Preserving, Using (Woodrow Wilson Birthplace Foundation), Program Series for Educational Communication Association, and World Conference on Records and Genealogical Seminar.
Manassas Heritage Lost (North South Trader), The Forms of Culture (Virginia Cultural Development Study Commission), and Guide to Effective Media Relations (SEMC Notes).
Virginia Phoenix negative film, volume 5, number 2, 1972 (from box 11 folder 5).
Virginia Phoenix layout, volume 6, numbers 1-2, 1973 (from box 11 folder 6).
